intro: Galenia africana, commonly known as the African galena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Galenia africana is known for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it a hardy species adapted to drought conditions.
